bibl.title: Letter to Lucian (?) Smith from Antonio Pergassa, August 24, 1924

div1.p: Pergassa corrects the date of the first appearance of yellow fever in Ceara from 1652 to 1851. He encloses a historical note about yellow fever in Brazil and suggests other literary material on the subject. Pergassa also encloses a list of yellow fever cases in February and March 1924 in various Brazilian towns.

div1.head: Letter to Lucian (?) Smith from Antonio Pergassa, August 24, 1924
div1.p:
In answer to your letter of August 12th, I beg to inform you that was a positive mistake
in the copy of my report for the date of appearence of yellow fever in Ceará was in June
1851, as it is stated in my report and not in 1652, as by mistake written in the “obser-
vações”.

Yellow fever first appearence in Icó and Iguatú was only in 1852 and Lavras in 1874
easily seen in my report just on the top part.

Unfortunately I have not all the copies of reports I sent you, but as per my note
book I could make a sumary of my observations, researches and informations obtained in
that State.

Herewith In enclose a short historical note about yellow fever in Brasil that you
may send to Dr. Carter.

It was organised by myself after comparing several statements, reports and books on
the subject, such as Reports presented by Dr. Joaquim Almeida Rego to the Provincial As-
sembly on the 7th October 1851 and 1st Setember 1852, Same by Dr. Herculano Cunha, on
11th of June 1856 page 23.

You may find good references about what you desire in the chapter salubrity O Ceará
no Centenario da Independencia do Brasil by Dr. Thomaz Pompeo de Souza Brasil 1922 page
473, where is quoted a great quantity of reports, statics and works, that helped me to
assure the various dates of appearence and existence of yellow fever in Ceará.
div1.closer:
With kind regards Signed: Antonio Pergossa' Aracajú, 24th August 924
L. C. S.
Inclosures with Dr. Pergossa's letter:
1: Short Notes on Yellow Fever in Brazil
2: Towns of Ceará Inspected by Dr.
Antonio Pergossa' in the Search
for yellow fever"
